snippet: Only a few years ago, Ciudad Juárez was a symbol of drug war devastation. But the killing has subsided, replaced by new businesses, returning residents and cautious hope.
abstract: Ciudad Juarez, border city that was once Mexico's murder capital and place of mass exodus, is experiencing a boom as thousands are coming back, led by young people; new restaurants, nightclubs and other businesses are replacing the drug war devastation; gritty city is trading paralysis and grief for stubborn hope, unresolved trauma and rapid reinvention.
lead_paragraph: Only a few years ago, Ciudad Juárez was a symbol of drug war devastation. But the killing has subsided, replaced by new businesses, returning residents and cautious hope.

headline.main: Ciudad Juárez, a Border City Known for Killing, Gets Back to Living
headline.print_headline: A Border City Known for Killing Gets Back to Living
